metadata.title: CVE-2023-6817 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tablescomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Thefunction nft_pipapo_walk did not skip inactive elements during set walkwhich could lead double deactivations of PIPAPO (Pile Packet Policies)elements, leading to use-after-free. We recommend upgrading past commit317eb9685095678f2c9f5a8189de698c5354316a.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
